name: CellRendererSpin

properties.name: adjustment
properties.description:
The adjustment that holds the value of the spinbutton. 
This must be non-%NULL for the cell renderer to be editable.

properties.name: climb-rate
properties.description: The acceleration rate when you hold down a button.

properties.name: digits
properties.description: The number of decimal places to display.

description:
#GtkCellRendererSpin renders text in a cell like #GtkCellRendererText from
which it is derived. But while #GtkCellRendererText offers a simple entry to
edit the text, #GtkCellRendererSpin offers a #GtkSpinButton widget. Of course,
that means that the text has to be parseable as a floating point number.

The range of the spinbutton is taken from the adjustment property of the
cell renderer, which can be set explicitly or mapped to a column in the
tree model, like all properties of cell renders. #GtkCellRendererSpin
also has properties for the #GtkCellRendererSpin:climb-rate and the number
of #GtkCellRendererSpin:digits to display. Other #GtkSpinButton properties
can be set in a handler for the #GtkCellRenderer::editing-started signal.

The #GtkCellRendererSpin cell renderer was added in GTK+ 2.10.
